intro: Gundelia, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus species. The plant is characterized by its hairy, yellow-green leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Gundelia thrives in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and limited water availability. It is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
